title: Kog isn't an attractive pick unless he's hilariously over-tuned
body:
Obviously Lucian's continued existence isn't helping, but that isn't the main issue here.

Now, mind, I'm not saying that Kog is bad.  Far from it.  But even when he *was* hilariously over-tuned, his pick rate wasn't particularly amazing.  The problem, I suspect, goes beyond him simply being a risk for his team (totally immobile, no hard CC).  Kog's problem is that heavy damage is *all he does*.  And unless that damage is leaps and bounds beyond what any other ADC can bring to the table (eg, Kog is hilariously over-tuned) there's absolutely no reason to pick him over ADCs that deal slightly less damage, but also boast mobility, utility, or more potent burst.

In other words, when the main draw of a class of champions is 'deal lots of damage' then having a champion *in* that class with 'deals lots of damage' as their only perk really isn't very compelling.

What Kog *needs* is some aspect that helps him to really stand out from other ADCs.  He needs a niche that no one else really covers.  And being good with OnHits isn't a niche.  It just limits the range of items Kog can grab that feel good on him.

Full build Vayne out DPSes Kog.  So does Twitch.  Kog's damage peaks at mid/early late because he runs out of items to buy.  He doesn't get the overlapping layers of multiplicative damage that the true hyper-carries have access to because his kit only multiplies OnHit effects, nothing else.

RiotRepertoir stated during the post-preseason patch fiddling that Riot's idea that Kog should only work with 5-man premades was inherently flawed because it's unfair to every Kog player who isn't in LCS.  And beyond that, there are other ADCs you can build a team around who have far more impact while also being more self-sufficient (hi {{champion:21}}).

Basically, Kog's partial remake shoe-horned him into a single play style that's *absurdly* difficult to balance, that most of the player base finds unfun, and has no place on teams unless it happens to be hilariously over-tuned.  Hence why this topic exists.  Kog needs another remake.  Ideally focusing on the interactive parts of his kit that are actually fun to use.

My issue with kog is less that he's all damage, but that he's very one dimensional.
It's basically press W, and watch him AA away till he dies or kills everyone, and which ever of those two happens is mostly in the hands of the rest of your team and your opponents.
For me, there is very little that kog actively can do to impact the outcome of a fight other than existing.
One could argue that snipeing lowhealth targets with the ult is a thing, but that usually only comes in after the fight once you won it and only have to clean up.
The high as of W makes stutterstepping nearly impossible unless your very, very high skilled mechanically, and the rest of his kit currently is pretty low impact by comparison.

I used to like Kog' Maw. The reason being he was fun to play, and had a few things that actually defined him as a hyper carry. Right now Riot made him just completely focused on high and consistent damage that doesn't promote varying styles of play. The old Kog' Maw however didn't just offer high consistent damage, he offered mixed damage, percent HP damage in abundance, and the use of his spells for some nice added in burst. Before the rework you were not just standing in place auto attacking and relying on your team to peel, sure you did get peel, but the main thing was kiting efficiently, positioning correctly, and weaving in spells to take advantage of their burst with trinity force. Right now with his current state I can't really see a big way to make him like his old state. Perhaps a change to help out this new "stand and auto attack" play style would be to promote it and give him a movement speed buff while moving on his E and increasing his ultimate's AoE.
